description:
Npackd (pronounced "unpacked") is a __C__ommand __L__ine __I__nterface store/package manager/marketplace for applications for Windows. It helps you to find and install software, keep your system up-to-date and uninstall it if no longer necessary. The process of installing and uninstalling applications is completely automated (silent or unattended installation and un-installation). There is also a command line based version of Npackd.

For the corresponding __G__raphical __U__ser __I__nterface, please see chocolatey package [npackd.install](https://chocolatey.org/packages/npackd.install).

[Manual (manpage)](https://github.com/tim-lebedkov/npackd/wiki/CommandLine)
[Forum](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/npackd)
[Wiki](https://github.com/tim-lebedkov/npackd/wiki)
summary: Command Line Interface for application store/package manager/marketplace of Windows applications
author: Tim Lebedkov
